channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Mathematical Introduction to Deep Learning: Methods, Implementations, and Theory
item.description: This book aims to provide an introduction to the topic of deep learning algorithms.

item.title: Video-Helpful Multimodal Machine Translation
item.description: In addition to the extensive training set, EVA contains a video-helpful evaluation set in which subtitles are ambiguous, and videos are guaranteed helpful for disambiguation.

item.title: A Transformer-Based Model With Self-Distillation for Multimodal Emotion Recognition in Conversations
item.description: Emotion recognition in conversations (ERC), the task of recognizing the emotion of each utterance in a conversation, is crucial for building empathetic machines.

item.title: Histopathological Image Analysis with Style-Augmented Feature Domain Mixing for Improved Generalization
item.description: Style transfer-based data augmentation is an emerging technique that can be used to improve the generalizability of machine learning models for histopathological images.

item.title: Balancing Act: Constraining Disparate Impact in Sparse Models
item.description: Model pruning is a popular approach to enable the deployment of large deep learning models on edge devices with restricted computational or storage capacities.

item.title: Learning to Play Chess from Textbooks (LEAP): a Corpus for Evaluating Chess Moves based on Sentiment Analysis
item.description: This paper examines chess textbooks as a new knowledge source for enabling machines to learn how to play chess -- a resource that has not been explored previously.

item.title: Brain-like Flexible Visual Inference by Harnessing Feedback-Feedforward Alignment
item.description: Our study presents FFA as a promising proof-of-concept for the mechanisms underlying how feedback connections in the visual cortex support flexible visual functions.

item.title: A hybrid approach for solving the gravitational N-body problem with Artificial Neural Networks
item.description: To increase the robustness of a method that uses neural networks, we propose a hybrid integrator that evaluates the prediction of the network and replaces it with the numerical solution if considered inaccurate.

item.title: Relative NN-Descent: A Fast Index Construction for Graph-Based Approximate Nearest Neighbor Search
item.description: For example, in experiments on the GIST1M dataset, the construction of the proposed method is 2x faster than NSG.

item.title: Making Large Language Models Better Data Creators
item.description: In our experiments we demonstrate that instruction-following LLMs are highly cost-effective data creators, and that models trained with these data exhibit performance better than those trained with human-labeled data (by up to 17. 5%) on out-of-distribution evaluation, while maintaining comparable performance on in-distribution tasks.

item.title: Parametric Fairness with Statistical Guarantees
item.description: Algorithmic fairness has gained prominence due to societal and regulatory concerns about biases in Machine Learning models.

item.title: Text-Transport: Toward Learning Causal Effects of Natural Language
item.description: To address this issue, we leverage the notion of distribution shift to describe an estimator that transports causal effects between domains, bypassing the need for strong assumptions in the target domain.

item.title: Amoeba: Circumventing ML-supported Network Censorship via Adversarial Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Specifically, we cast the problem of finding adversarial flows that will be misclassified as a sequence generation task, which we solve with Amoeba, a novel reinforcement learning algorithm that we design.

item.title: Learning From Mistakes Makes LLM Better Reasoner
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) recently exhibited remarkable reasoning capabilities on solving math problems.

item.title: Distil the informative essence of loop detector data set: Is network-level traffic forecasting hungry for more data?
item.description: To answer this, we propose an uncertainty-aware traffic forecasting framework to explore how many samples of loop data are truly effective for training forecasting models.

item.title: Generate What You Prefer: Reshaping Sequential Recommendation via Guided Diffusion
item.description: Scrutinizing previous studies, we can summarize a common learning-to-classify paradigm -- given a positive item, a recommender model performs negative sampling to add negative items and learns to classify whether the user prefers them or not, based on his/her historical interaction sequence.

item.title: Utilitarian Algorithm Configuration
item.description: We prove upper bounds on the runtime of these procedures that are similar to theoretical lower bounds, while also demonstrating their performance empirically.

item.title: Linked Papers With Code: The Latest in Machine Learning as an RDF Knowledge Graph
item.description: In this paper, we introduce Linked Papers With Code (LPWC), an RDF knowledge graph that provides comprehensive, current information about almost 400, 000 machine learning publications.

item.title: Ling-CL: Understanding NLP Models through Linguistic Curricula
item.description: We employ a characterization of linguistic complexity from psycholinguistic and language acquisition research to develop data-driven curricula to understand the underlying linguistic knowledge that models learn to address NLP tasks.

item.title: Latent Field Discovery In Interacting Dynamical Systems With Neural Fields
item.description: Systems of interacting objects often evolve under the influence of field effects that govern their dynamics, yet previous works have abstracted away from such effects, and assume that systems evolve in a vacuum.

item.title: Analyzing the Impact of Companies on AI Research Based on Publications
item.description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is one of the most momentous technologies of our time.

item.title: HEDNet: A Hierarchical Encoder-Decoder Network for 3D Object Detection in Point Clouds
item.description: To reduce computational costs, these methods resort to submanifold sparse convolutions, which prevent the information exchange among spatially disconnected features.

item.title: HWD: A Novel Evaluation Score for Styled Handwritten Text Generation
item.description: Through extensive experimental evaluation on different word-level and line-level datasets of handwritten text images, we demonstrate the suitability of the proposed HWD as a score for Styled HTG.

item.title: GACE: Geometry Aware Confidence Enhancement for Black-Box 3D Object Detectors on LiDAR-Data
item.description: Widely-used LiDAR-based 3D object detectors often neglect fundamental geometric information readily available from the object proposals in their confidence estimation.

item.title: Calibration by Distribution Matching: Trainable Kernel Calibration Metrics
item.description: Calibration ensures that probabilistic forecasts meaningfully capture uncertainty by requiring that predicted probabilities align with empirical frequencies.

item.title: PsyCoT: Psychological Questionnaire as Powerful Chain-of-Thought for Personality Detection
item.description: Drawing inspiration from Psychological Questionnaires, which are carefully designed by psychologists to evaluate individual personality traits through a series of targeted items, we argue that these items can be regarded as a collection of well-structured chain-of-thought (CoT) processes.

item.title: Language Guided Visual Question Answering: Elevate Your Multimodal Language Model Using Knowledge-Enriched Prompts
item.description: Visual question answering (VQA) is the task of answering questions about an image.

item.title: Non-Compositionality in Sentiment: New Data and Analyses
item.description: When natural language phrases are combined, their meaning is often more than the sum of their parts.

item.title: Information-Theoretic Trust Regions for Stochastic Gradient-Based Optimization
item.description: Before each update, it solves the trust region problem for an optimal step size, resulting in a more stable and faster optimization process.

item.title: Bilateral Network with Residual U-blocks and Dual-Guided Attention for Real-time Semantic Segmentation
item.description: To be precise, we use the Dual-Guided Attention (DGA) module we proposed to replace some multi-scale transformations with the calculation of attention which means we only use several attention layers of near linear complexity to achieve performance comparable to frequently-used multi-layer fusion.

item.title: General-Purpose Retrieval-Enhanced Medical Prediction Model Using Near-Infinite History
item.description: This approach effectively eliminates the need for manual feature selection and enables an unrestricted observation window.

item.title: Recaptured Raw Screen Image and Video Demoiréing via Channel and Spatial Modulations
item.description: The spatial modulation utilizes the feature with large receptive field to modulate the feature with small receptive field.

item.title: Erato: Automatizing Poetry Evaluation
item.description: We present Erato, a framework designed to facilitate the automated evaluation of poetry, including that generated by poetry generation systems.

item.title: Extracting Entities of Interest from Comparative Product Reviews
item.description: This paper presents a deep learning based approach to extract product comparison information out of user reviews on various e-commerce websites.

item.title: Energy-Aware Adaptive Sampling for Self-Sustainability in Resource-Constrained IoT Devices
item.description: In the ever-growing Internet of Things (IoT) landscape, smart power management algorithms combined with energy harvesting solutions are crucial to obtain self-sustainability.

item.title: Machine learning detects terminal singularities
item.description: Together with the first sketch of the landscape of Q-Fanos in higher dimensions, this gives new evidence that machine learning can be an essential tool in developing mathematical conjectures and accelerating theoretical discovery.

item.title: DDAM-PS: Diligent Domain Adaptive Mixer for Person Search
item.description: The objective of the two bridge losses is to guide the moderate mixed-domain representations to maintain an appropriate distance from both the source and target domain representations.

item.title: Network Contention-Aware Cluster Scheduling with Reinforcement Learning
item.description: With continuous advances in deep learning, distributed training is becoming common in GPU clusters.

item.title: From Denoising Training to Test-Time Adaptation: Enhancing Domain Generalization for Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: In medical image segmentation, domain generalization poses a significant challenge due to domain shifts caused by variations in data acquisition devices and other factors.

item.title: BasisFormer: Attention-based Time Series Forecasting with Learnable and Interpretable Basis
item.description: Bases have become an integral part of modern deep learning-based models for time series forecasting due to their ability to act as feature extractors or future references.

item.title: Contrastive Difference Predictive Coding
item.description: Predicting and reasoning about the future lie at the heart of many time-series questions.

item.title: InstructCoder: Empowering Language Models for Code Editing
item.description: In this work, we explore the use of large language models (LLMs) to edit code based on user instructions, covering a broad range of implicit tasks such as comment insertion, code optimization, and code refactoring.

item.title: Bridging the Gap Between Variational Inference and Wasserstein Gradient Flows
item.description: Variational inference is a technique that approximates a target distribution by optimizing within the parameter space of variational families.

item.title: Automatic Evaluation of Generative Models with Instruction Tuning
item.description: Automatic evaluation of natural language generation has long been an elusive goal in NLP. A recent paradigm fine-tunes pre-trained language models to emulate human judgements for a particular task and evaluation criterion.

item.title: Which Examples to Annotate for In-Context Learning? Towards Effective and Efficient Selection
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) can adapt to new tasks via in-context learning (ICL).

item.title: MIST: Medical Image Segmentation Transformer with Convolutional Attention Mixing (CAM) Decoder
item.description: One of the common and promising deep learning approaches used for medical image segmentation is transformers, as they can capture long-range dependencies among the pixels by utilizing self-attention.

item.title: Adaptive Anchor Label Propagation for Transductive Few-Shot Learning
item.description: Our novel algorithm, Adaptive Anchor Label Propagation}, outperforms the standard label propagation algorithm by as much as 7% and 2% in the 1-shot and 5-shot settings respectively.

item.title: MoCa: Measuring Human-Language Model Alignment on Causal and Moral Judgment Tasks
item.description: A rich literature in cognitive science has studied people's causal and moral intuitions.

item.title: LitCab: Lightweight Calibration of Language Models on Outputs of Varied Lengths
item.description: For evaluation, we construct CaT, a benchmark consisting of 7 text generation tasks, covering responses ranging from short phrases to paragraphs.

item.title: Adversarial Attacks and Defenses in Large Language Models: Old and New Threats
item.description: Here, one major impediment has been the overestimation of the robustness of new defense approaches due to faulty defense evaluations.
